testCases.testScenario: Verify auto-fill of address fields when restaurant name exists on Google but not in DB
testCases.testCaseDescription: Test the scenario where a user enters a restaurant name that is found on Google but not present in the application's database. The system should automatically populate the address-related fields (Country, State, City, Area) based on the Google search results.
testCases.testSteps: Navigate to the Foodchow POS Sign-up page   In the 'Restaurant Name' field, enter a valid restaurant name that is known to exist on Google but not yet registered in the Foodchow database (e.g., 'New Cafe & Bistro')   Observe the address-related fields (Country, State, City, Area).
testCases.expectedResult: The 'Country', 'State', 'City', and 'Area' fields should be automatically populated with the address details retrieved from Google for 'New Cafe & Bistro'.
testCases.actualResult: When user open sign-up form first time  , Address fields are auto fill based on user current location and when user select a  searched location from Google ,all fields are update based on Restaurant location

testCases.testScenario: Verify 'add different name' prompt when restaurant name exists  in DB
testCases.testCaseDescription: Test the scenario where a user enters a restaurant name that exists on Google and is also already present in the Foodchow database. The system should prompt the user to add another name, preventing duplicate registrations.
testCases.testSteps: Navigate to the Foodchow POS Sign-up page   In the 'Restaurant Name' field, enter the name 'Existing Eatery'   Attempt to proceed or observe system feedback.
testCases.expectedResult: The system should display a message indicating that the restaurant name 'Existing Eatery' is already registered and prompt the user to 'add another name' or similar, preventing further progression with the existing name.
testCases.actualResult: when user enter restaurant name that already exist  , it give message "Restaurant name is already taken"

testCases.testScenario: Verify manual input for restaurant name (not on Google, not in DB)
testCases.testCaseDescription: Test the scenario where a user manually enters a restaurant name that is neither found on Google nor present in the Foodchow database. Address fields should remain empty for manual entry.
testCases.testSteps: Navigate to the Foodchow POS Sign-up page   In the 'Restaurant Name' field, enter a unique name that is unlikely to be on Google or in the DB (e.g., 'My Brand New Local Spot 123')   Observe the address-related fields (Country, State, City, Area).
testCases.testData: Restaurant Name: 'My Brand New Local Spot 123'
testCases.expectedResult: The 'Country', 'State', 'City', and 'Area' fields should remain empty, allowing the user to manually fill them. No error message should be displayed regarding the restaurant name.
testCases.actualResult: When user open a sign-up page, fields are auto-fill based  on the user's current location, so when user add new restaurant, the user need to manually change the address, and user can manually fill out all the details.

testCases.testScenario: Verify validation for empty Restaurant Name field
testCases.testCaseDescription: Test that the 'Restaurant Name' field is mandatory and displays an appropriate error message if left empty when attempting to proceed.
testCases.testSteps: Navigate to the Foodchow POS Sign-up page   Leave the 'Restaurant Name' field empty   Fill all other mandatory fields with valid data (if any are enabled for partial validation)   Attempt to proceed to the next step of the sign-up process (e.g., click 'Next' or 'Sign Up Part 2' button).
testCases.expectedResult: An error message indicating that 'Restaurant Name' is a required field should be displayed. The user should not be able to proceed.
testCases.actualResult: The error text field  message is display when the restaurant field is empty

testCases.testScenario: Verify Restaurant Name field accepts alphanumeric and common characters

testCases.testSteps: Navigate to the Foodchow POS Sign-up page   In the 'Restaurant Name' field, enter a name containing letters, numbers, spaces, and acceptable special characters (e.g., 'O'Malley's Cafe & Bar 123-A')   Proceed with the rest of the sign-up process (or observe field validation).
testCases.expectedResult: The input should be accepted without any validation errors specific to the characters used.
testCases.actualResult: when user enter name with special character, it allow name as long as it did not taken by any other restaurant

testCases.testScenario: Edge case: Network timeout during Google search for Restaurant Name
testCases.testCaseDescription: Test the application's behavior when network connectivity is slow or times out while the system is attempting to search for the entered restaurant name on Google.
testCases.testSteps: Navigate to the Foodchow POS Sign-up page   In the 'Restaurant Name' field, enter a valid restaurant name (e.g., 'The Green Spoon')   Wait for the Google search to attempt to resolve the address   Observe the address fields and any error messages after the simulated timeout.
testCases.expectedResult: The system should display an appropriate message indicating a timeout or inability to fetch data. Address fields should remain empty, and the user should be prompted to manually fill them or retry. No indefinite loading state.
testCases.actualResult: Pending

testCases.testScenario: Positive flow: Location details auto-filled on page load based on user's current location
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify that 'Country', 'State', 'City', 'Area' fields are automatically populated upon page load based on the user's detected IP-based geographic location.
testCases.testSteps: Navigate to the Foodchow POS Sign-up page   Observe the 'Country', 'State', 'City', 'Area' fields immediately after the page loads.
testCases.expectedResult: The 'Country', 'State', 'City', and 'Area' fields should be pre-filled with 'India', 'Maharashtra', 'Mumbai', and 'Bandra' respectively (or similar based on actual user location).
testCases.actualResult: when user first open sign-up page, app ask for location permission, and when user give the permission, fields are autofilled based on the user's location.

testCases.testScenario: Positive flow: Manual selection of Country, State, City, Area
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify that the user can manually select values for 'Country', 'State', 'City', and 'Area' fields, overriding any auto-filled values or filling empty ones.
testCases.testSteps: Navigate to the Foodchow POS Sign-up page   Clear any auto-filled values (if applicable) or leave them empty   Select 'United States' from the 'Country' dropdown   Select 'California' from the 'State' dropdown (which should populate after Country selection)   Select 'Los Angeles' from the 'City' dropdown   Select 'Hollywood' from the 'Area' dropdown   Verify the selected values are retained.
testCases.testData: Country: 'United States', State: 'California', City: 'Los Angeles', Area: 'Hollywood'
testCases.expectedResult: All selected fields ('Country', 'State', 'City', 'Area') should display the manually chosen values correctly.

testCases.testScenario: Negative flow: Invalid combination of Country/State/City (e.g., selecting a state not belonging to selected country)
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify that the system prevents or corrects invalid geographical selections (e.g., selecting a state that is not part of the previously selected country).
testCases.testSteps: Navigate to the Foodchow POS Sign-up page   Select 'United States' from the 'Country' dropdown   Attempt to select 'Maharashtra' from the 'State' dropdown (assuming it's a value listed from a global list, but not valid for US)   Observe the system's response.
testCases.expectedResult:
The system should either:
a) Prevent the selection of 'Maharashtra' as a state for 'United States'.
b) Display an error message indicating an invalid combination.
c) Automatically clear the invalid selection if a valid state is not found.

testCases.testScenario: Edge case: Geo-location service failure or user denial

testCases.expectedResult: The 'Country', 'State', 'City', and 'Area' fields should remain empty, allowing the user to manually fill them without displaying an error specific to location services.
testCases.actualResult: When user denies location access, fields stay empty, and the user can manually add an address.

testCases.testScenario: Successful Staff Login with valid credentials.
testCases.expectedResult: The staff member 'johndoe' is successfully logged in and redirected to the 'Start Order' screen or the staff's limited access dashboard.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify that an active staff member can successfully log in using their username from the dropdown and the correct 4-digit PIN.

testCases.testSteps: Click on the 'Staff Login' option.  Select the staff member 'johndoe' from the dropdown list.  Enter an incorrect 4-digit PIN (e.g., '0000') using the on-screen digit pad.  Click the 'Login' button (or equivalent action after PIN entry).
testCases.testScenario: Unsuccessful Staff Login with incorrect PIN.
testCases.expectedResult: An error message indicating 'Incorrect PIN' or 'Invalid Credentials' is displayed. The staff member remains on the login screen.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify that an active staff member cannot log in if an incorrect PIN is entered.

testCases.testSteps: Click on the 'Staff Login' option.  Select the disabled staff member 'disabledstaff' from the dropdown list.  Enter their correct 4-digit PIN (e.g., '9876') using the on-screen digit pad.  Click the 'Login' button (or equivalent action after PIN entry).
testCases.testScenario: Unsuccessful Staff Login with a disabled staff member.
testCases.expectedResult: An error message indicating 'Staff account is disabled' or 'Login not allowed' is displayed. The staff member remains on the login screen.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify that a disabled staff member cannot log in even with the correct PIN.

testCases.testSteps: Click on the 'Staff Login' option.  Attempt to open the staff selection dropdown.
testCases.actualResult: when staff is not register or all staff memeber are disable  , message display in drop down  , no staff members are available
testCases.testScenario: Edge Case: Staff dropdown is empty when no staff are registered.
testCases.expectedResult: The dropdown should be empty, disabled, or display a message like 'No staff registered'. The login process should clearly indicate that no staff can log in.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify the behavior of the staff selection dropdown when no staff members have been registered by the admin.

testCases.testSteps: Click on the 'Staff Login' option.  Select 'johndoe' from the dropdown.  Enter the correct PIN '1234'.  Initiate network disconnection.  Click the 'Login' button.  Observe the application's response.
testCases.testScenario: Edge Case: Network outage during staff login attempt.
testCases.expectedResult: The application should display an appropriate error message (e.g., 'Network unavailable', 'Failed to connect'). The staff member should NOT be logged in. Upon network restoration, the user should be able to retry or proceed gracefully.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify how the system handles a network disconnection while attempting to log in as a staff member.

testCases.testSteps: Click on the 'Staff Login' option.  Attempt to select or manually enter a staff member name that does not appear in the dropdown (if manual entry is possible).  Enter a PIN.  Click the 'Login' button.
testCases.actualResult: In the staff login page there is only dropdown menu and all staff member usernames are displayed. Those details are enter by admin and there is no option for ener mannal entry for enter username
testCases.testScenario: Unsuccessful Staff Login with non-existent staff member (not in dropdown).
testCases.expectedResult: If dropdown prevents selection, the test ends there. If there's an attempt to login with non-existent staff (e.g., due to a UI bug or direct API call), an error message like 'Staff not found' or 'Invalid credentials' should be displayed. Login should fail.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify that a staff member not present in the dropdown (e.g., manually entered or deleted) cannot log in.

testCases.testSteps: Locate and click on the 'Start Order' option/button.  Verify the redirection to the order creation interface.
testCases.actualResult: When successfully entered, staff members can access start-order page
testCases.testScenario: Verify 'Start Order' access for logged-in staff.
testCases.expectedResult: The staff member is successfully navigated to the 'Start Order' interface, allowing them to initiate new orders.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Confirm that a successfully logged-in staff member can access the 'Start Order' functionality.

testCases.testSteps: Access the side menu.  Locate and click on the 'Settings' option.  Verify that the staff member can view and interact with the permitted settings (e.g., printer settings, theme, etc.) but not admin-level settings.
testCases.actualResult: When staff member logs in, first page open is Start-order , and all settings are inside. staff can only access those  ,,  , all the admin related pages are outside of start order and staff can not access those
testCases.testScenario: Verify access to allowed 'Settings' for logged-in staff.
testCases.expectedResult: The staff member is successfully navigated to a 'Settings' screen, displaying only the settings relevant and accessible to their role. Admin-specific settings are not visible or are disabled.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Confirm that a successfully logged-in staff member can access the specific 'Settings' allowed for their role.

testCases.testSteps: Locate and click on the 'Home' button/icon (e.g., in a side menu or top bar).  Observe the redirection.
testCases.testScenario: Verify 'Home' button redirects staff to login dashboard.
testCases.expectedResult: The staff member is redirected to the initial login dashboard screen where they would select a staff member and enter a PIN.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Confirm that clicking the 'Home' button redirects the logged-in staff member back to the login dashboard screen, preventing further access without re-login.

testCases.testSteps: As 'johndoe', attempt to navigate to known admin modules (e.g., 'Manage Staff', 'Reports', 'System Configuration' not available through staff settings).  This could involve looking for menu items or trying direct URL/route navigation if applicable.
testCases.actualResult: Staff can only access pages that are inside Start-order , and when they click on Home, it redirects them to the login dashboard page
testCases.testScenario: Attempt to access restricted admin modules as a staff member.
testCases.expectedResult: The staff member should not see options for admin modules. If an attempt is made to access them, an error message ('Access Denied') or redirection to a permitted screen should occur.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify that a logged-in staff member cannot access modules or functionalities intended only for admin users.
